title: Understanding the Product Rule
text: The product rule for exponents states that when you multiply two powers with the same base, you can add their exponents.

title: Identify the Base and Exponents
text: In the expression $${\left(-3\right)}^5 \left(-3\right)$$, notice that both parts have the same base, which is $$-3$$. When the base is the same, you're allowed to add the exponents.

title: What is the Implicit Exponent?
text: Recognize that the second part of the expression is $${\left(-3\right)}^1$$. Write down the exponent on the second base explicitly.

title: Simplify the Expression
text: Add the exponents of the two powers. This means adding $$5$$ and $$1$$, since $${\left(-3\right)}^5 {\left(-3\right)}^1$$ becomes $${\left(-3\right)}^{5+1}$$.

title: Calculate the New Exponent
text: Find the sum of the exponents: $$5+1$$. This will give you the exponent for the single base.
